paragraph: CHAPTER 9.

As soon as Ready had executed his intentions, and had fed the animals, he went to the cabin and called Mr Seagrave and William.  With their assistance the sheers were raised, and secured in their place; the boat was then hooked on, but, as one person was required to bear it clear of the davits and taffrail, they could not hoist it in.
tokens: ready execute intention feed animal go cabin call assistance sheer raise secure place boat hook person require bear clear davit taffrail hoist

paragraph: "Master William, will you run down to Juno, and tell her to come on deck to assist us--we must all work now?"
tokens: master run tell come deck assist work

paragraph: William soon returned with Juno, who was a strong girl; and, with her assistance, they succeeded in getting the boat in.
tokens: return strong girl assistance succeed get boat

paragraph: The boat was turned over, and Ready commenced his work; while Mr Seagrave, at his request, put the pitch-pot on the galley fire, all ready for pitching the canvas when it was nailed on.  It was not till dinner-time that Ready, who had worked hard, could patch up the boat; he then payed the canvas and the seams which he had caulked with pitch both inside and out.
tokens: boat turn ready commence work request put pitch pot galley fire ready pitch canvas nail dinner time ready work patch boat pay canvas seam caulk pitch

paragraph: "I think we shall do now, sir," said Ready; "we'll drag her to the gangway and launch her.  It's fortunate for us that they did clear away the gunnel, as we shall have no trouble."
tokens: think do sir say ready drag gangway launch fortunate clear gunnel have trouble

paragraph: A rope was made fast to the boat, to hold her to the ship: she was then launched over the gunnel by the united exertions of Mr Seagrave and Ready, and to their great satisfaction she appeared to leak very little.
tokens: rope make boat hold ship launch gunnel united exertion ready great satisfaction appear leak little

paragraph: "Now, sir," said Ready, "what shall we do first--take some things on shore, or some of the children?"
tokens: sir say ready do first take thing shore child

paragraph: "What do you say, Ready?"
tokens: say ready

paragraph: "I think as the water is as smooth as glass, and we can land anywhere, you and I had better go first to reconnoitre,--it is not two hundred yards to the beach, and we shall lose but little time."
tokens: think water smooth glass land have good go first reconnoitre yard beach lose little time

paragraph: "Very well, Ready, I will first run down and tell my wife."
tokens: ready run tell wife

paragraph: "And, in the meanwhile, I'll put the sail into the boat, and one or two other things."
tokens: meanwhile put sail boat other thing

paragraph: Ready put the sail in, an axe, a musket, and some cord; then they both got into the boat and pulled on shore.
tokens: ready put sail axe musket cord get boat pull shore

paragraph: When they landed, they found that they could see nothing of the interior of the island, the cocoa-nut groves were so thick; but to their right they perceived, at about a quarter of a mile off, a small sandy cove, with brushwood growing in front of the cocoa-nut trees.
tokens: land find see interior island cocoa nut grove thick right perceive quarter mile small sandy cove brushwood grow front cocoa nut tree

paragraph: "That," said Ready, pointing to it, "must be our location.  Let us get into the boat again and pull to it."
tokens: say ready point location let get boat pull

paragraph: In a few minutes they arrived at the cove; the water was shallow, and as clear as crystal.  Beneath the boat's bottom they could see beautiful shells, and the fish darting about in every direction.
tokens: few minute arrive cove water shallow clear crystal boat bottom see beautiful shell fish dart direction

paragraph: The sand extended about forty yards from the water, and then commenced the brushwood, which ran back about forty yards further, intermingled with single cocoa-nut trees, until it joined the cocoa-nut grove.  They pulled the boat in and landed.
tokens: sand extend yard water commence brushwood run yard intermingle single cocoa nut tree join cocoa nut grove pull boat land

paragraph: "What a lovely spot this is!" exclaimed Mr Seagrave; "and perhaps mortal man has never yet visited it till now: those cocoa-nuts have borne their fruit year after year, have died, and others have sprung up in their stead; and here has this spot remained, perhaps for centuries, all ready for man to live in, and to enjoy whenever he should come to it."
tokens: lovely spot exclaim mortal man visit cocoa- nut borne fruit year year die other spring stead have spot remain century ready man live enjoy come

paragraph: "Providence is bountiful, Mr Seagrave," replied Ready, "and supplies our wants when we least expect it.  If you please we will walk a little way into the wood: take the gun as a precaution, sir; not that there appears to be much occasion for it--there is seldom anything wild on these small islands, except a pig or two has been put on shore by considerate Christians."
tokens: bountiful reply ready supply want least expect walk little way wood take gun precaution sir appear be much occasion be wild small island pig put shore considerate

paragraph: "Well, now that we are in the grove, Ready, what do you think?"
tokens: grove ready think

paragraph: "I was looking for a place to fix a tent up for the present, sir, and I think that on that little rise would be a very good place till we can look about us and do better; but we have no time now, sir, for we have plenty of trips to make before nightfall.  If you please, we'll haul the sail and other articles on to the beach, and then return on board."
tokens: look place fix tent present sir think little rise good place look do good have time sir have plenty trip make nightfall haul sail other article beach return board

paragraph: As they were pulling the boat back, Ready said, "I've been thinking about what is best, Mr Seagrave.  Would Mrs Seagrave mind your leaving her?--if not, I should say we should have Juno and William on shore first, as they can be of use."
tokens: pull boat ready say think good mind leave say have shore use

paragraph: "I do not think that she will mind being left on board with William and the children, provided that I return for her when she is to come on shore herself with the baby."
tokens: think mind leave board child provide return come shore baby

paragraph: "Well then, let William remain on board, if you please, sir.  I'll land you and Juno, Tommy, and the dogs, this time, for they will be a protection in case of accidents.  You and Juno can be doing something while I return by myself for the other articles we shall require."
tokens: let remain board sir land dog time protection case accident do return other article require

paragraph: As soon as they arrived on board, Mr Seagrave went down to cheer his wife with the account of what they had seen.  While he was down below, Ready had cast off the lashings of the two spars which had formed the sheers, and dragging them forward, had launched them over the gunnel, with lines fast to them, ready for towing on shore.  In a few minutes Juno and Tommy made their appearance on deck; Ready put some tools into the boat, and a couple of shovels, which he brought up when he went for the dogs, and once more they landed at the sandy cove.  Tommy stared about him a great deal, but did not speak, until he saw the shells lying on the beach, when he screamed with delight, and began to pick them up as fast as he could; the dogs barked and galloped about, overjoyed at being once more on shore; and Juno smiled as she looked around her, saying to Ready, "What a nice place!"
tokens: arrive board go cheer wife account see ready cast lashing spar form sheer drag launch gunnel line ready towing shore few minute make appearance deck ready put tool boat couple shovel bring go dog land sandy cove stare great deal speak see shell lie beach scream delight begin pick dog bark gallop overjoy shore smile look say ready nice place

paragraph: "Now, Mr Seagrave, I'll remain on shore with you a little.  First, we'll load the musket in case of need, and then you can put it out of the way of Tommy, who fingers everything, I observe.  We will take up the sail between us.  Juno, you can carry the tools; and then we can come back again for the spars, and the rope, and the other things. Come, Tommy, you can carry a shovel at all events, and that will make you of some use."
tokens: remain shore little load musket case need put way finger observe take sail carry tool come spar rope other thing come carry shovel event make use

paragraph: Having taken all these things to the little knoll which Ready had pointed out before, they returned for the spars; and in two trips they had carried everything there, Tommy with the second shovel on his shoulder, and very proud to be employed.
tokens: take thing little knoll ready point return spar trip carry second shovel shoulder proud employ

paragraph: "Here are two trees which will answer our purpose pretty well," said Ready, "as they are far enough apart: we must lash the spars up to them, and then throw the sail over, and bring it down to the ground at both ends; that will be a beginning, at all events; and I will bring some more canvas on shore, to set up the other tent between these other trees, and also to shut up the two ends of both of them; then we shall have a shelter for Madam, and Juno, and the younger children, and another for William, Tommy, and ourselves.  Now, sir, I'll just help you to lash the spars, and then I'll leave you to finish while I go on board again."
tokens: tree answer purpose say ready lash spar throw sail bring ground end beginning event bring more canvas shore set other tent other tree shut end have shelter young child sir help lash spar leave finish go board

paragraph: "But how can we reach so high, Ready?"
tokens: reach high ready

paragraph: "Why, sir, we can manage that by first lashing a spar as high as we can conveniently reach, and then standing on that while we lash the other in its proper place.  I shall bring another spar on shore, that we may do the same when we set up the other tent."
tokens: sir manage lash spar high reach stand lash other proper place bring spar shore do same set other tent

paragraph: Having by this plan succeeded in lashing the spar high enough, and throwing the sail over the spar, Ready and Mr Seagrave spread it out, and found that it made a very good-sized tent.
tokens: have plan succeed lash spar throw sail spar ready spread find make good sized tent

paragraph: "Now, sir, I'll return on board; in the meantime, if you can cut pegs from the brush-wood to fasten the sail down to the ground, and then with the shovel cover the bottom of it with sand to keep it down, it will be close enough when it is all finished."
tokens: sir return board meantime cut peg brush wood fast sail ground shovel cover bottom sand keep close finish

paragraph: "I shall do very well," replied Mr Seagrave; "Juno can help me to pull the canvas out tight when I am ready."
tokens: do reply help pull canvas tight ready

paragraph: "Yes; and in the meantime, Juno, take a shovel, and level the inside of the tent nice and smooth, and throw out all those old cocoa-nut leaves, and look if you see any vermin lurking among them.  Master Tommy, you must not run away; and you must not touch the axes, they will cut you if you do.  It may be as well to say, Mr Seagrave, that should anything happen, and you require my assistance, you had better fire off the gun, and I will come on shore to you immediately."
tokens: meantime take shovel level inside tent nice smooth throw old cocoa nut leave look see vermin lurk master run touch axe cut say happen require assistance have good fire gun come shore
